title: Erigon+Lighthouse Stops Sync after Nil Pointer Dereference
body:
## System information | Attribute | Value | | --- | --- | | Erigon Version | `2022.09.1-alpha` | | OS | Arch Linux (Linux 5.19.8 `x86_64`) | | Consensus Layer | lighthouse `v3.1.0-aa022f4` | ## Expected behaviour Erigon keeps running ## Actual behaviour Erigon freezes and all synchronization stops. At this stage, I don't have a whole lot of log information as I had to do a reset of the machine which resulted in corrupted `journald` logs. If it happens again, I will update with the relevant information. EDIT: See below for a log. I do have information from the metrics recorded by Prometheus, and in particular, the following have been observed: - The value of `go_memstats_alloc_bytes_total` saturates at close to 460 MiB/s - The value of `go_cgo_calls_count` saturates at around 300K calls/sec - The value of `db_commit_seconds_count` also saturates at around 1.50 Kops/s ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3196162/190837555-1f934600-7e80-4cea-a718-c413834c20cc.png) I am also starting to investigate the metrics on the Lighthouse side to see if anything anomalous appears there, but so far everything looks normal (other than the errors relating to Erigon going out of sync). I will update as I find more information. ### Logs The error happened once again, and here is the entire log of the few minutes beforehand and the moment Erigon starts spamming the logs:
journalctl -u erigon -u lighthouse-beacon-node ``` Sep 17 13:03:01 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:01.825] [1/15 Headers] Waiting for Beacon Chain... Sep 17 13:03:02 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:02.492] Flushing in-memory state Sep 17 13:03:02 asrock lighthouse[1147]: Sep 17 03:03:02.544 INFO New block received root: 0x88a9305f0a9ae19d36ab11eabe9874161004cffcece5a3fd8f5b6f167a987265, slot: 4713313 Sep 17 13:03:05 asrock lighthouse[1147]: Sep 17 03:03:05.001 WARN Head is optimistic execution_block_hash: 0xbdb93c22ed05952172ede77cffffe11188b425bff7c0215c5ef5e6bb04f1ff8e, info: chain not fully verified, block and attestation production disabled until execution engine syncs, service: slot_notifier Sep 17 13:03:05 asrock lighthouse[1147]: Sep 17 03:03:05.001 INFO Synced slot: 4713313, block: 0x88a9…7265, epoch: 147291, finalized_epoch: 147289, finalized_root: 0xa402…d93f, exec_hash: 0xbdb9…ff8e (unverified), peers: 65, service: slot_notifier Sep 17 13:03:05 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:05.005] Timings (slower than 50ms) Headers=1.146s CallTraces=151ms AccountHistoryIndex=117ms StorageHistoryIndex=233ms LogIndex=360ms TxLookup=111ms Prune TxLookup=600ms Prune AccountHistoryIndex=395ms Sep 17 13:03:05 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:05.005] Tables PlainState=73.9GB AccountChangeSet=1.5GB StorageChangeSet=2.7GB BlockTransaction=7.7GB TransactionLog=271.3GB FreeList=56.1MB ReclaimableSpace=56.1GB Sep 17 13:03:07 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:07.177] Commit cycle in=2.171721658s Sep 17 13:03:07 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:07.177] RPC Daemon notified of new headers from=15550502 to=15550503 header sending=9.493µs log sending=1.465µs Sep 17 13:03:07 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:07.177] [1/15 Headers] Waiting for Beacon Chain... Sep 17 13:03:08 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:08.225] [1/15 Headers] Fork choice missing header with hash bdb93c22ed05952172ede77cffffe11188b425bff7c0215c5ef5e6bb04f1ff8e Sep 17 13:03:08 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:08.225] [1/15 Headers] Downloading PoS headers... height=0 hash=0xbdb93c22ed05952172ede77cffffe11188b425bff7c0215c5ef5e6bb04f1ff8e requestId=1954 Sep 17 13:03:08 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:08.225] Timings (slower than 50ms) Headers=1.047s Sep 17 13:03:08 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:08.225] Tables PlainState=73.9GB AccountChangeSet=1.5GB StorageChangeSet=2.7GB BlockTransaction=7.7GB TransactionLog=271.3GB FreeList=56.1MB ReclaimableSpace=56.1GB Sep 17 13:03:08 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:08.225] Commit cycle in=13.332µs Sep 17 13:03:08 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:08.225] RPC Daemon notified of new headers from=15550503 to=15550504 header sending=6.771µs log sending=977ns Sep 17 13:03:08 asrock erigon[2535]: [INFO] [09-17|13:03:08.225] [1/15 Headers] Waiting for Beacon Chain... What seems to be the error in particular is the nil pointer dereference, after which Erigon goes on an infinite loop of waiting for the beacon chain, and then immediately saying that the fork choice is missing header with some hash (many times per second). ``` Sep 17 13:04:52 asrock erigon[2535]: [EROR] [09-17|13:04:52.382] Staged Sync err="runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference, trace: [stageloop.go:129 panic.go:890 panic.go:260 signal_unix.go:835 fork_validator.go:279 fork_validator.go:216 stage_headers.go:673 collector.go:276 collector.go:144 stage_headers.go:686 stage_headers.go:732 stage_headers.go:195 stage_headers.go:163 default_stages.go:20 sync.go:352 sync.go:255 stageloop.go:163 stageloop.go:84 asm_amd64.s:1594]" ``` ## Steps to reproduce the behaviour Start Erigon and Lighthouse with the following parameters ```sh ExecStart=/usr/bin/erigon \ --datadir=/eth/erigon \ --http.api eth,erigon,engine,web3 \ --authrpc.port 8551 \ --authrpc.jwtsecret /eth/jwt.hex \ --private.api.addr localhost:8552 \ --metrics \ --prune htc \ --prune.r.before=11184524 ``` ```sh ExecStart=/usr/bin/lighthouse beacon_node \ --datadir /eth/lighthouse \ --staking \ --metrics \ --validator-monitor-auto \ --execution-endpoint http://localhost:8551 \ --execution-jwt /eth/jwt.hex ``` ## Related I created this issue not knowing exactly the underlying cause and have been updating my findings since. From reading other people's bug reports, the following are all probably the same bug: - #5382 - #5390 - #5407

Due to another issue (#5412), I am unable to run 2022.09.02 for very long and thus do no know whether it is still an issue.
From reading the description by @mohoff, my issue isn't as severe as a restart does allow Erigon to sync further (that is, I don't face the same issue at the same block every time)

> Does it still happen with [v2022.09.02](https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/releases/tag/v2022.09.02)?

I ran v2022.09.02 for two days now and at least during that time this problem ('infinite loop') didn't happen. However, I've rolled it back to v2022.09.01 again as it appears that in the new version erigon barely manages to stay in sync, or loses its sync very often (as described in https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/5412 i suppose)

I am currently testing the version that maybe fixes everything, the image is `thorax/erigon:docker_revert_5401`, if I can't reproduce the infinite loop on any of the test nodes, we will go ahead and make a hotfix release with that.

If you are brave enough, you can try it yourself too. The risk it getting this infinite loop back.

Lighthouse Validator:

```
[Unit]
Description=Lighthouse Consensus Client VC (Goerli Test Network)
Wants=network-online.target
After=network-online.target

[Service]
User=lighthousevalidator
Group=lighthousevalidator
Type=simple
Restart=always
RestartSec=5
ExecStart=/usr/local/bin/lighthouse vc \
  --network goerli \
  --datadir /var/lib/lighthouse \
  --suggested-fee-recipient KEY \
  --graffiti "chupaco"

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target%
```
Lighthouse Beacon:

```
[Unit]
Description=Lighthouse Consensus Client BN (Goerli Test Network)
Wants=network-online.target
After=network-online.target

[Service]

Group=lighthousebeacon
```
